20510.name: {2Sac{7red{5 He{6ali{2ng {7Gar{5den{6s{x

description: {WThe {Ygolden mist{W which shrouded this room lifts to reveal an
opulantly decorated chamber.  The wall to the right is dominated by
floor-to-ceiling bookshelves.  There is a bed in the center of the
room which has a carved headboard of mahogony.  A multitude of woven
reed fans circle above the bed creating both a canopy and a cooling
breeze.  A soft glowing light hovers above a night stand next to the
bed.  {x
20540.name: Lostis' Love Chamber

description: This small stone room beneath the Temple of the Apostles seems to serve
many purposes.  Mirrors line the walls and the floor is covered with a
beautiful rose quartz sun.  To the east, a large door is inset in the wall
with the symbol of Sune's priesthood above it.  On the west wall is another
large door, this one displaying the mesmerizing face of the goddess herself.
To the north a small, indescript door is in the wall, with no marks to
identify it.  The south contains a door that glows with magical power, and
on the other side you see the Temple of Sune in Westbridge.
20505.name: Beneath the Temple of the Apostles

description: {!       ;;;;{1oOOoOOoOOoOOoOOo{!;;;. .,. .;;;{1oOOoOOoOOoOOoOOo{!;;;;

hill ending in front of a lake.  The lake is the color of {Yp{golishe{Gd
{Yg{gol{Gd{8.  Dozens of tiny {ci{Cr{mi{Md{We{gs{Mc{ge{Cn{gt {8winged birds alternately fly into
and then dive from the lakes' lone tree, an ancient {Ww{gi{Gll{go{Ww{8.  The
breadth of the trees branches is so expansive and dense that the
ground beneath is always shaded.{x

{8that are {Yimportant {Rand {8distraction {Yfrom many {8aspects of the

20532.name: A Hallway below the Temple of the Apostles

description: You glimpse a reflection of yourself and smile, pleased with
the gifts of beauty that Sune herself has bestowed upon you.

20502.name: Hall of Mirrors

description: This is a large room containing many training dummies and other
training tools.  A rack of weapons stands on one side of the room, and
a bookshelf containing combat spellbooks stands on the other.  In the
center of the room is a large dummy depicting Novalaki, enemy of the
Apostles of Sune.
20501.name: Training Room of the Apostles

description: Two large hooded lanterns enlighten the white marble archway
at the entrance of the large office of Hravngud "{rG{Yu{RD{x" Hiltopple.
Several {rb{Ru{yr{Yn{yi{Rn{rg {xtorches reveal the rest of the room. In the
far right corner stands a large square office table made out
of dark {yoaken {xwood. Two thin, identical looking bookshelves
cover the corner wall behind the desk.
Looking towards the left of the room you can not stop but notice
an extremely large {rH{Ro{yl{Yy Sy{ym{Rbo{rl {xof the goddes {rS{yu{Rn{Ye {xin the middle
of the back wall. This symbol is fiery hot {Rred{x, as the bottom of
the symbol rests in a stone trench filled with burning oil, as a
tribute to the one {rFi{Rre{ylo{Yrd, Ko{yss{ruth{x.
In the left corner of the room sits a comfortable {Yhealing {ysofa{x
and two large {yleather {xarmchairs. A small cabin holds several
bottles of liquor and some glasses.
At the door stands Idlasgud, loyal servant to the Hiltopples.
20537.name: {rG{Yu{RD{x's working office

description: {* Hooded b{yras{*s l{ya{Wn{wte{Wr{yn{*s hung low to the ground light the path.{x
{* You notice a faint g{Wl{wi{Wm{wm{We{*r in the bottom
{* of the brook.  A fallen {Ws{wta{Cr{*, you think.{x
{* You peer into one of the cottage {Ww{wi{Yn{yd{Yo{ww{Ws{*.  Dozens
{* of ca{yn{Wd{wl{*es cast a warm {Yg{ylo{Yw{* about the small room,
{* at the center of which is a rather elegant bed of
{* unfinished {yo{ga{yk{*.  Perhaps you should go before you
{* catch a glimpse of something {Rp{rr{*iva{rt{Re{* or indecent.{x
{* Looking down from the {Cb{yr{Wid{yg{Ce{*, you watch the night sky
{* s{Wh{wi{Wm{wm{We{*r on the surface of a small brook. The {cw{Ca{wt{Ce{cr{* is
{* so clear that even on this {Bd{bar{Bk{* night you can see the
{* little {cf{Ci{Ws{gh{* who inhabit it swimming by happily.{x
{* A wide {Ws{yt{Won{we{* bridge with {Ww{yoode{Wn{* railings, this is
{* the perfect spot to {Rs{Yt{ye{Ya{Rl {ya {Rk{ris{Rs{* from your lover.{x
{* A wide {Ws{yt{Won{we{* bridge with {Ww{yoode{Wn{* railings, this is
{* the perfect spot to {Rs{Yt{ye{Ya{Rl {ya {Rk{ris{Rs{* from your lover.{x
Winding away from the grove, a small path lined with l{ya{Wn{wte{Wr{yn{*s near to
the ground leads off into the dark night.  The tree branches overhead
keep out the {wm{Yo{Wo{wnl{Wig{wht{* for a short distance before letting light pour
back down as the trees part for a small {Cb{croo{Ck{*.  Arching slightly over
the water, a {Wc{yob{Wb{wl{*e{Ws{*t{Wo{wn{ye{* {Wb{yridg{We{* allows passage to the far bank.  Dark
and brilliant, the water murmurs softly as the night {ws{Yt{Ma{wr{Ws{* dance upon
its surface.  Across the bridge, the {gt{yrai{gl{* wanders through a few last
trees before ending at a small stone cottage.  A golden glow radiates
from the {Ww{wi{Yn{yd{Yo{ww{Ws{*, making it seem so warm and inviting.  A sign on the
door however states that this cottage is for "{RE{rleni {*and {MS{mamoth{*" only.

20514.name: Entrance to the {YF{Borest {rof {RB{Beauty

description: This tower offers a view of the world in all directions through a set of
windows. However the images do not seem to flow together and they each
emit a faint magical aura. This is the portal room of the Apostles of Sune
when the members may travel to far off realms, through the power of their
goddess.
20504.name: Tower in the Temple of Sune

description: This small room contains a large rectangular table, with two seats
resting on each long side.  Behind each long side the walls are lined
with statues, one side the previous High Priests and Priestesses, the
other side the previous Leaders Vance, Cariodoc, Loreleix, Sfen,
Keldon, Moira and Menhara.  On the far side of the room is single
gigantic statue, depciting Sune, with a gigantic rose bush behind her,
emitting holylight and backlighting the statue.
20509.name: Leader's Meeting Room

description: This large stone room is the inner sanctum of the priesthood of
Sune Here Sune's holy priests come to meditate and to live.
Tapestries line the walls depicting memorable events in the history of
the priesthood, and small cots are lined up in one corner of the room.
20507.name: Priesthood's Inner Sanctum

description: This large room contains paintings depicting glorious scenes of
angels in various stages of love making.  Cots are strewn across the
room, and a incense burner is here burning a heavy aphrodisiac.
20508.name: Love Lounge of Sune

20530.name: A Hallway below the Temple of the Apostles

description: {* Yo{Wu ar{we so beaut{Yi{wful.  You must be in {Wlov{*e.{x
{* A {Rv{relve{Rt p{rillo{Rw{* neatly embroidered with the words:
{*E{Wle{wni loves Sam{Wot{*h{x
{* A {Rv{relve{Rt p{rillo{Rw{* neatly embroidered with the words:
{*E{Wle{wni loves Sam{Wot{*h{x
{* The round {ws{Wk{cy{Cli{cg{Wh{wt{* over the bed gives a perfect
{* view of the sky.  From here, no matter the time
{* of day or weather, everything {Wa{wlway{Ws{* is perfect
{* and {Ra{Ym{ya{Wz{yi{Yn{Rg{*.  The bed is always warm during the
{* day as sunlight pours down from above, while at
{* night, lovers may name s{wt{*ar{Ws{* after each other.{x
{* A hundred candles fl{Yi{wc{*ke{Wr{* and glow all around
{* the room. Some rest on iron pedestals, others
{* on short wooden tables with small m{Wir{wr{Wor{*s and
{* trinkets reflecting the light and filling the
{* room with an {wet{Wh{ce{Cr{wea{Wl {ws{Mh{wi{Wm{Cm{me{Wr{*.  How romantic!
Warmly lit with a hundred {wc{Wa{yn{Yd{yl{We{ws{* of varying sizes, the inside of the
cottage is but a single room sparsely decorated.  A few small m{Wir{wr{Wor{*s
hang from the walls, reflecting the fl{Yi{wc{*ker{Win{*g candlelight and adding
to the ambience.  In a back corner is a small kitchen, a {cc{Cr{wyst{Ca{cl{* vase
full of {Gl{gongste{Gm {Rr{ro{Rs{re{Rs{* sitting on the countertop.  A massive bed with
black bedding takes up most of the room, a single {Rh{rear{Rt{r-{Rs{rhape{Rd{* pillow
among the darkness.  The knotted wooden posts stretch to the ceiling,
thin branches extending from each to weave a tangled oak frame around
the {wgr{Wan{cd {Csk{cyl{Wig{wht{*.  The stars above keep quiet watch over the lovers
in all their passion through the night, while the {Yg{yolden su{Yn{* peers in
to find them in tender embrace, sleeping blissfully as morning comes.{x

description:
{CAs you glance upon this lovely seraphic creation of Sune you are{x
{Ccaptivated by her beauty and sensuality. At first she appears to be{x
{Cdressed in a diaphanous gown, but upon closer inspection she is {x
{Csimpley wraped in her diaphanous wings offering the apperance of a{x
{Cgown. The love and passion she emotes would embarrass and perplex{x
{Cany who was not familiar in the ways of Sune. Her eye's are {Gdeep{x
{Gpools of shining emerald{C and embue a wealth of knowledge. Her{x
{CPlump {RRuby red lips{C are full and glisten as if she has just {x
{Cmoistened them with her tounge. {rRed hair{C flows about her slender{x
{Cyet vivacious body as it cascades to the floor. As she notices your{x
{Cglance she winks and blows a kiss in your direction.{x.
20502.room_name: An almost tangible bloom of serenity envelops the enchanting, winged figure here.

description:
A priest cloaked in the purest fire of beauty and passion stands here
as a personal servant to any that have use for his >wink wink< "services."
He is indeed beautiful touched by Lady Sune herself and his devotion runs
as deeply as his blessings.
 
You also notice a striking resemblence to Hravungud ... I guess they are
either closely related or I guess the saying "You are what you eat" applies
to Idlasgud.
